narrative:
The task was to open the Notes application and count the number of tags present in the user's Notes account.

The agent approached this task by using a bash command to launch the Notes application on macOS. It executed the command 'open -a Notes' which is the standard way to open applications via the command line on macOS. After issuing the command, the agent waited for 2 seconds to allow the application sufficient time to fully load and display its interface.

Once the Notes application was open and visible, the agent examined the left sidebar where tags are typically displayed in the Notes app. The agent systematically counted each tag present: #bm, #checklist, #home, #p44, #recipe, #shoveit, and #therapy. The final count revealed that the user has 7 tags in total in their Notes application. This was a straightforward task that required opening the application and performing a visual count of the displayed tags.
